Diced Chicken with Spicy Chilies 辣子鸡丁

November 30, 2021
Jump to Recipe Print Recipe

It’s a no wonder that many people love this as a side dish that goes with beer or alcohol. For me, I had it served with rice but it was still very good nevertheless. Simple as it may seem but the marinated chicken along with the gingers, garlics, dried chilies and Szechuan peppercorns all give the dish a very flavorful aroma.

It doesn’t take long to whip up this dish as well and a bit regretful that I prepped too little in this instant as it was gone in an instant after serving up and below recipe is meant for 1 to 2 pax so you be sure to double or triple the serving as I’m pretty sure it will be a real popular dish.

Happy munching !

Diced Chicken with Spicy Chilies 辣子鸡丁

Recipe by Eat What TonightCourse: SidesCuisine: ChineseDifficulty: Easy
Servings

1

servings
Prep time

10

minutes
Cooking time

20

minutes

Ingredients

  • 150g diced boneless chicken leg, de-skinned

  • 12 pcs dried chilies, soaked in water to soften, cut into sections

  • 2 tbsp cooking oil

  • 1 tsp Szechuan peppercorns

  • 2 small bulbs of garlic, sliced

  • 5-6 thin slices of ginger

  • 2-3 tbsp water

  • 1 tbsp cooking wine

  • Some sesame seeds

  • For the Chicken Marinade (marinate for an hour) :

  • 1 3/4 tsp light soya sauce

  • 1 tbsp ginger juice

  • 1/2 tsp sugar

  • Pinch of pepper

  • 4 tsp corn flour


Directions

  • Marinate chicken, cover and set aside in the fridge for an hour.
  • Heat up 1 tbsp cooking oil and panfry marinated chicken till cooked and remove from flame (helps to release excess oils from chicken).
  • Add to air-fryer to grill for further 5 mins at 160 degrees C or till browned. Remove and set aside.
  • Heat up balance cooking oil and saute ginger and garlic slices.
  • Add Szechuan pepper and dried chilies and stir-fry to bring out the aroma.
  • Add water if it starts to get too dry. Add chicken pieces and stir-fry to mix well.
  • Add cooking wine and stir-fry till chicken are dry. Off heat and sprinkle sesame seeds all over. Mix well and serve hot immediately to enjoy.

Related

Spinach Egg Tofu
Country Style Chicken Stew

Time to stock up on these hot favourites for the upcoming holiday season ! *Not available for dine-in, only take-away and online orders.

@beechenghiangsg has unveiled a unique and exclusive baked snack, the Crispy Pulled Pork Twist 脆烤肉丝, a unique TWIST to Bee Cheng Hiang's Pork Floss. They are handcrafted using 100% natural ingredients, with no artificial flavouring, colouring or preservatives. This crisp and addictive treat definitely makes an awesome movie snack. Available at 2 packs (each pack contains 8 smaller packs) for $39.90 at all #beechenghiangsg outlets, online at https://www.beechenghiang.com.sg/crispy-pulled-pork-twist-200g/ and on app.

Homestyle Fried Meatballs, remake of Mum’s signature meatballs. Difference is I used a lot more water chestnuts than her. ☺️🤤 Recipe 食谱 (makes around 90-100pcs of 1 tsp amount of meatball size) : 500g minced meat肉碎 22pcs water chestnut, minced 马蹄剁碎 1 egg, 鸡蛋 2 tbsp light soya sauce酱青 1/2 tsp pepper 胡椒粉 2 tbsp corn flour生粉 1 tsp salt盐 Some cooking oil for deep frying, 适量油炸肉丸 Method: 1) Chop water chestnuts finely and squeeze out excess water through a sieve. 2) Combine water chestnuts with minced meat and all the rest of the ingredients. 3) Combine everything by hand and throw the mixture a few times into mixing bowl under sticky. 4) Cover and set it overnight in fridge. Roll into 1 heaping teaspoon amount of meatballs by hand. 5) Heat up some cooking oil and deep fry meatballs till golden brown. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oils before serving.

The 5 dishes are : 🍚Pearl Rice with Baby Abalone and Olive Vegetables 小鲍鱼橄榄菜伴珍珠米饭 🍯Honey Pork Chop with Kumquat Sauce 金橘汁焗猪扒 🥥Double-boiled Whole Coconut with Black Chicken 原粒椰子炖乌鸡汤 🫚Homemade Ginger Tofu with Minced Pork 菜香姜汁豆腐 🥦Seasonal Vegetables 蒜香时蔬 🎗️And for a good cause, 100 per cent of proceeds from the sale of these promotional dishes will be donated in kind to Dementia Singapore to help care for persons with dementia and their caregivers.

Follow
Cooking my favourite Prawn Noodle Kway Teow Soup with prawn heads and shells from 2kg worth of prawns. Cooked a huge batch of this and freeze up the soup so that I can enjoy preservatives and MSG-free prawn noodle soup anytime now. 😊 Other than rock sugar, there’s crushed garlics, pork ribs, carrots and also radish to sweeten the soup more naturally. These large live glass prawns sourced from @9sseafood are very fresh and has a firm texture which I really like. And they come wholly de-shelled so I just accumulate the prawn shells in the freezer for cooking occasions like this. Other seasoning include grind pepper and sea salt. Took a good 4ish hours of cooking and simmering over the stovetop but finish up this bowl in less than 15mins. 😂
4 weeks ago

Homestyle Fried Meatballs, remake of Mum’s signature meatballs. Difference is I used a lot more water chestnuts than her. ☺️🤤 Recipe 食谱 (makes around 90-100pcs of 1 tsp amount of meatball size) : 500g minced meat肉碎 22pcs water chestnut, minced 马蹄剁碎 1 egg, 鸡蛋 2 tbsp light soya sauce酱青 1/2 tsp pepper 胡椒粉 2 tbsp corn flour生粉 1 tsp salt盐 Some cooking oil for deep frying, 适量油炸肉丸 Method: 1) Chop water chestnuts finely and squeeze out excess water through a sieve. 2) Combine water chestnuts with minced meat and all the rest of the ingredients. 3) Combine everything by hand and throw the mixture a few times into mixing bowl under sticky. 4) Cover and set it overnight in fridge.
